Function Documentation

void iField_evaluate ( const iField_Instance  instance,
iField_TensorHandle  tensor_handle,
const double *  coords,
iBase_EntityHandle *  entity_handle,
void **  field_values,
int *  field_values_allocated,
int *  field_values_size,
int *  err 
)

Evaluate a compound field with no location hint.

This is the expensive case, because we have to find the entity first. Might as well return it for future use.... Note that, for this case, coordinates are in the physical coordinate frame: if you're using parametric coordinates for a known entity, use evaluateInEnt even if the point lies physically outside the entity. See notes for evaluateInEnt

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
tensor_handle  [in] Field to act on.
coords  [in] Coordinates at which to evaluate dfunc.
entity_handle  [out] Entity in which dfuncs were evaluated.
field_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
field_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
field_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)

void iField_evaluateAllDF ( const iField_Instance  instance,
const iField_TensorHandle  tensor_handle,
const iBase_EntityHandle  entity_handle,
const double  coords[3],
const int  is_param,
double **  dfunc_values,
int *  dfunc_values_allocated,
int *  dfunc_values_size,
int *  err 
)

Return the values of all dfuncs at a given point.

For a tensor_handle (and therefore distribution function kernel), find all distribution function values at a particular location. This function provides a way to get the results of multiple calls to an iField_DFuncKernel in one API call. dfunc_values* is the usual ITAPS array syntax.

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
tensor_handle  [in] Tensor handle to act on.
entity_handle  [in] Entity in which dfuncs will be evaluated.
coords  [in] Coordinates at which to perform the evaluation.
is_param  [in] True if coords are dfunc parametric coords; false for tensor physical coord system.
dfunc_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
dfunc_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
dfunc_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)

int *  err

Return the gradients of all dfuncs at a given point.

For a tensor_handle (and therefore distribution function kernel), find all distribution function gradients at a particular parametric location. This function provides a way to get the results of multiple calls to an iField_DFuncKernel in one API call. dfunc_values* is the usual ITAPS array syntax.

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
tensor_handle  [in] Tensor handle to act on.
entity_handle  [in] Entity in which dfuncs will be evaluated.
coords  [in] Coordinates at which to perform the evaluation.
is_param  [in] True if coords are parametric; false for tensor physical coord system.
storage_order  [in] Should data be blocked or interleaved?
dfunc_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
dfunc_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
dfunc_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
dfunc_grad_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
dfunc_grad_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
dfunc_grad_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)

void iField_evaluateInEnt ( const iField_Instance  instance,
iField_TensorHandle  tensor_handle,
const iBase_EntityHandle  entity_handle,
const double *  coords,
const int  is_param,
int *  precision,
void **  field_values,
int *  field_values_allocated,
int *  field_values_size,
int *  err 
)

Evaluate a compound field at a point in a known entity.

Knowing which entity should allow significant optimization. In the collective call, each set of coordinates must have an entity handle to go with it. NOTE: This function returns all data at the same precision. The implementation is responsible for returning a pointer to the location of that data; the application is responsible for correctly interpreting the data at that address. If (a pointer to) iField_DEFAULT_PRECISION is passed in, the implementation will return data at the highest precision used by any component field tensor and set *precision to this value. Array sizes are given in terms of number of floating point numbers at *precision, NOT in terms of bytes. This implies conversion to a pointer to floating point number before doing pointer arithmetic. CFOG Oct 4, 2010 To handle evaluation of solution, gradient, Hessian, etc for a field, do we want to add functions, or add an arg to the current functions specifying what to evaluate?

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
tensor_handle  [in] Tensor instance to act on.
entity_handle  [in] Entity in which dfuncs will be evaluated.
coords  [in] Coordinates at which to evaluate dfunc.
is_param  [in] True if coords are parametric; false for tensor physical coord system.
precision  [in,out] Precision of output data.
field_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
field_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
field_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)

void iField_evaluateNearEnt ( const iField_Instance  instance,
iField_TensorHandle  tensor_handle,
const iBase_EntityHandle  entity_handle,
const double *  coords,
int *  precision,
void **  field_values,
int *  field_values_allocated,
int *  field_values_size,
int *  err 
)

Evaluate a compound field at a point near a known entity.

This is the case that will be intermediate in efficiency. Note that, for this case, coordinates are in the physical coordinate frame: if you're using parametric coordinates for a known entity, use evaluateInEnt even if the point lies physically outside the entity. See notes for evaluateInEnt

Parameters:
instance  [in] iField instance handle
tensor_handle  [in] Tensor to act on.
entity_handle  [in] Entity near which dfuncs will be evaluated.
coords  [in] Coordinates at which to evaluate dfunc.
precision  [in,out] Precision of output data.
field_values  [in,out] Data is returned here.
field_values_allocated  [in,out] Allocated size of data array.
field_values_size  [out] Used size of data array.
err  [out] Returned Error status (see iBase_ErrorType)
